original: Öberg, Johan (John) Efraim, ämneslärare, Borås, f. 12/6/93’ i Örebro av järnv:tj:man Carl Ö. o. Matilda Eriksson. G. 36 m. Sonja Jacobsson. — Stud:ex. 12, fil. kand. i Upps. 17, stud. v. Sthlms handelshögsk. 17-18. Varit anst. s. bitr. red. å hand :avd. i Nord. Presscentralen A-B i Sthlm, korresp. i Sv. Hand :banken, vik. kassör o. kamr. v. A-B Sv. Tekn:fören. Förlag i Sthlm, e. o. lär. v. Örebro h. folk-sk. 21-24, v. Borås h. folksk. fr. 24, ord. ämneslär. i modersm., tyska o. hand:kunsk. där 25. Res. t. Tyskl. o. Engl. Hobbies: sport, spec. orientering.
translated: Öberg, Johan (John) Efraim, teacher, Borås, b. 12/6/93 in Örebro, son of railway worker Carl Ö. and Matilda Eriksson. Married in 1936 to Sonja Jacobsson. — Graduated high school in 1912, Bachelor of Arts in Uppsala in 1917, studied at Stockholm School of Economics in 1917-1918. Previously worked as assistant editor in the trade department at Nord. Presscentralen A-B in Stockholm, correspondent at Sv. Handelsbanken, acting cashier and accountant at A-B Sv. Tekn:fören. Förlag in Stockholm, substitute teacher at Örebro h. folk-sk. from 1921-1924, and at Borås h. folk-sk. from 1924. Appointed regular subject teacher in native language, German, and business knowledge there in 1925. Traveled to Germany and England. Hobbies: sports, especially orienteering.

education.credentialName: Studied at Stockholm School of Economics
